column4: there is a good guide to installing azureus on ubuntuguide.org
the forums version isn't the working way to install it.
not sure what you mean it worked fine for me?
They tell you to install from synaptic right?

That's the borked version. You need to manually install the beta then load azureus as root in order to install the swt library, and then you still need to switch to sun java for the right tools, it's just easier to manually install.
huh strange; oh well, heh, i'd stick with utorrent anyways :)
You need wine for it to work right?
and i tend to use wine a alot
Well, I like the Azureus plugins. RSS feeder etc.
yea, i used to be a huge azureus fan, but its such a resource hog... (at least the old version was)
I use the CVS versions, cutting edge updates. Plus a voting system is built into Azureus and we can tell them what features we want them to work on.
I think the memory managment won several months back.
How can I tell how much memory Azureus is taking in Ubuntu?
Wow, Azureus hardly takes any memory in Ubuntu. Sweet!
dont java apps preform better in linux as compared to windows?
I dunno, I'm still using Sun's java rather than the OSS version since I do a lot of java programming.
